frameDefinitions: A Protagonist is described as being exposed to a potentially dangerous situation that may end in a Bad_outcome for him- or herself.
A Cognizer carries out an approximate calculation or considers some Evidence so as to arrive at an approximate Value for some Feature of an Item.
This frame has to do with the repetition (and especially the frequency of repetition) of an event.
An Employee has a Position doing work in a particular Field, or doing work on a particular Task, for which an Employer gives Compensation to the Employee.
An Experimenter conducts an Experiment based on a Hypothesis.
A Gambler commits an Asset to a prediction that an Uncertain_situation will have a particular Outcome (or class of outcomes).
frameExamples: Until 1971, dolphin mortality could be <t>estimated</t> only from analyses of vessels ' logbooks -- and the figures are probably underestimates. CNI
China will have to face a high <t>frequency</t> of sand storms in the years to come.
Undocumented foreigners are <t>working</t> as  building contractors for Laing Builders.
Johann's <t><fex name='Experiment'>experiment</fex></t> proved the new drug was effective in treating the disease.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who is at risk of some <fen>Bad_outcome</fen>
A situation that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> would like to avoid.
Something desirable possessed by or directly associated with the <fen>Protagonist</fen> which might be lost or damaged.
The <fen>Action</fen> that creates the risk.
The time when the risk pertains.
The place where there is risk.
The individual who considers evidence or performs calculations to arrive at an approximation.
The feature is a scalar property of the <fen>Item</fen>.
The position or area  on the <fen>Feature</fen> scale that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> concludes the <fen>Item</fen> occupies.
The entity that possesses the <fen>Feature</fen> whose <fen>Value</fen> the <fen>Cognizer</fen> seeks to approximate.
A proposition expressing the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s approximation of a <fen>Feature</fen>'s <fen>Value</fen>.
An open proposition for which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> seeks to approximate the <fen>Value</fen> of a variable.
The time period during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> forms the estimate of the <fen>Feature</fen>'s <fen>Value</fen>.
The location in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> forms their estimate.
This role is used for any (bounded) <fen>Event</fen> whose frequency or iteration is described.
The extent to which the actually observed rate of occurrence of the <fen>Event</fen> or <fen>Salient_entity</fen> differs from the expected rate.
The <fen>Interval</fen> is a noun modified by the target word. The target word specifies the frequency of the <fen>Interval</fen> .
The <fen>Time_span</fen> is the length of time of the <fen>Interval</fen>. This role is incorporated by most of the lexical units in this frame.
The number of times per unit of real or scanning time that an <fen>Event</fen> or <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is encountered.
An entity which the implicit cognizer encounters with the specified frequency.
The frequency feature of the <fen>Event</fen> or <fen>Salient_entity</fen> that is under discussion. All the lexical units in this frame incorporate this frame element.
The Time when the Event has a particular frequency.
The <fen>Employee</fen> is obligated to perform a <fen>Task</fen> in order to receive <fen>Compensation</fen>.
The <fen>Employer</fen> gives <fen>Compensation</fen> to an <fen>Employee</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place_of_employment</fen> of the <fen>Employee</fen>.
The label given to a particular type of employment.
The <fen>Employee</fen> is obligated to perform the <fen>Task</fen> to recieve <fen>Compensation</fen> from the <fen>Employer</fen> .
This role identifies the <fen>Field</fen> in which one works.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> period during which an <fen>Employee</fen>  works for an <fen>Employer</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Employee</fen> works.
The <fen>Experimenter</fen> is the individual conducting the <fen>Experiment</fen>.
The group of entities in the <fen>Experiment</fen> which have not been treated and are compared to the <fen>Treatment_group</fen> or <fen>Treated_individual</fen>.
An individual entity of the <fen>Experiment</fen> which is left untreated and then compared with the <fen>Treatment_group</fen> or the <fen>Treated_individual</fen>.
A group of subjects that receive Treatment and are compared to the <fen>Control_group</fen> or <fex name='Controlled_individual'>Controlled_individuals</fex>.
An individual subject that receives treatment and is then compared to the <fen>Control_group</fen> or <fen>Controlled_individual</fen>.
The test or <fen>Experiment</fen> conducted by the <fen>Experimenter</fen> using a <fen>Control_group</fen> and a <fen>Treatment_group</fen>.
The <fen>Hypothesis</fen> is a conjecture as to the result of an <fen>Experiment</fen>.  The <fen>Experiment</fen> takes place in order to prove the <fen>Hypothesis</fen> as correct or incorrect.

In this frame <fen>Control_group</fen> and <fen>Treatment_group</fen> can be combined and expressed as <fen>Subjects</fen>.  This role can also be used for a generic individual on whom the <fen>Experiment</fen> is being conducted (see second example).
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject that the <fen>Experiment</fen> is studying.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Experimenter</fen> conducts the <fen>Experiment</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> in which the <fen>Experiment</fen> is conducted.
The person who wages the <fen>Asset</fen> on a certain Outcome.
Something desirable possessed by or directly associated with the <fen>Gambler</fen> which is lost if the <fen>Gambler</fen> loses the wager.
The <fen>Gambler</fen> predicts that a certain <fen>Outcome</fen> will hold.
The <fen>Gambler</fen> predicts how an <fen>Uncertain_situation</fen> will resolve.
The time when the <fen>Gambler</fen> makes the wager.
The place where the <fen>Gambler</fen> makes the wager.
listRoleExamples: There was no risk <fex>of his returning</fex>.
The risk <fex>to his reputation</fex> was significant.
<fex>Implementing this program</fex> runs the risk of offending our core constituents.
<fex>Even after the end of Apartheit</fex> we still run the risk of letting racism continue forever.
There is always some danger to rich men <fex>in a bar like this</fex>.
<fex>The government</fex> estimated the cost of meeting EC water standards at £3-4 billion.

In one march from 42 Street down to Washington Square Park, the crowds were
estimated <fex>in size</fex> from 125000 (NYPD estimate) to over 200000 (march organizers).
Sotheby 's have estimated its value <fex>at $10m-$14m</fex>.
I estimated <fex>the house</fex> at about 60-65% full.
At the time they estimated <fex>there to be as many as four million to the acre</fex>.
Then Sandia estimated <fex>how many people would die and be injured within the first year due to their radiation exposure</fex>.
The US Forest Service estimated <fex>last year</fex> that 45 million piñons have died so far in north-central New Mexico.
<fex>At the London School of Economics</fex> they estimated that China would have to spend 2% of gross. domestic product on higher. education for 15 years
The country has been struck by frequent <fex>economic crises</fex>.
The Crested Lark (Galerida cristata) is  <fex>very</fex> frequent from the coastal plain to the mountains.
The meetings occurred at fortnightly <fex>intervals</fex>.
You have to renew the license every <fex>year</fex> .
The state government spends its fiscal year 2006 budget of $23.4 billion at a rate <fex>of $742 per second</fex>.
It costs about US$2.50 to travel 200km (124 mi), but <fex>buses</fex> are infrequent and only one or two buses a day service most routes.
These exposures were likely to be intermittent <fex>in frequency</fex> occurring only when workers were participating in activities at these specific areas.
<fex>My Mom</fex> works for the Michigan Department of Agriculture.
My mom works <fex>for an Eye Doctor</fex>.
The undocumented foreigners were working <fex>at the organic farm</fex>.
Louise works <fex>as an engineer</fex>.
My dad works <fex>building houses.</fex>
Undocumented foreigners work <fex>in construction</fex> for years.

<fex>From 2000-2001</fex>, Mr. Eckhardt clerked for The Honorable Jerry A. Funk,
United States Bankruptcy Judge, Middle District of Florida.
Most people work <fex>in the city</fex>.
<fex>Justin's</fex> experiment turned out to be rather successful.
<fex>One rat's</fex> treatment caused it to outlive the rats of the control group.
Katrina tested <fex>her hypothesis</fex> yesterday afternoon.
They were hoping to conduct an experiment <fex>on the albino rats</fex>.
Jimmy conducted an experiment <fex>on tropical plants in non-tropical environments</fex>.
